Uses of Class
oru.inf.InfException

    • Uses of InfException in oru.inf

      Methods in oru.inf that throw InfException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void InfDB.checkConnection()
      Checks if the DB connection is closed and if so initiates it
      private void InfDB.closeConnection()
      Closes the DB connection
      void InfDB.delete(java.lang.String query)
      Deleting a row from the DB using SQL syntax DELETE FROM.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> InfDB.fetchColumn(java.lang.String query)
      Fetches a column from the DB, if the query returns several columns, the first one is selected.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> InfDB.fetchRow(java.lang.String query)
      Fetches one row from the DB, if the query has several rows the first one is selected.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> InfDB.fetchRows(java.lang.String query)
      Fetches 1 to N number of rows from the DB into an ArrayList of HashMaps where the ArrayList index is the row and the HashMap contains the rows values with the columns "NAME" as its key.
      java.lang.String InfDB.fetchSingle(java.lang.String query)
      Fetches a single value from the DB, if the query returns several values, the first one is selected.
      java.lang.String InfDB.getAutoIncrement(java.lang.String table, java.lang.String attribute)
      Retrieves and counts a number upwards for a column that contains Integers, to simulate an incrementing number.
      private void InfDB.initConnection()
      Opens a connection to the DB
      void InfDB.insert(java.lang.String query)
      Inserting a row into the DB using SQL syntax INSERT INTO.
      private void InfDB.modifyDB(java.lang.String query)
      Modifies the DB with any SQL DDL or SQL DML INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE
      void InfDB.update(java.lang.String query)
      Updating a row or value in the DB using SQL syntax UPDATE ...
      Constructors in oru.inf that throw InfException 
      Constructor and Description
      InfDB(java.lang.String dbName)
      InfDB Constructor for the DB class initiates a default connection to the database using the name of the database as parameter.
      InfDB(java.lang.String dbName, java.lang.String port, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      InfDB Constructor for the DB class initiates a connection to the database using the name of the database, the port to the local MySQL Server, and the MySQL username and MySQL password as parameters.
